title.narrative: Call for Senior Expert Programme candidates

description.narrative: An application can be submitted by a Senior Expert employed at a Dutch research organisation⁵ who participates within a CGIAR Research Program (CRP) or Platform with linkages to one or more of the four priority knowledge domains of the MoU. It is emphasized that there is a preference for applications that have linkages with the sustainable agri-food value chains & sectors, genetic improvement and propagation materials, and/or climate smart agriculture knowledge domain, and target focus regions for development cooperation of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Further, the added value of the senior expert should relate to the Dutch IAR strengths.

One of the foci of the strategic partnership between CGIAR and the Government of the Netherlands is a better use of the strength and quality of Dutch agricultural research to the benefit of CGIAR and achievement of common objectives. Therefore the aim of this call for SEP candidates is to support the participation of Dutch research organisations in CGIAR. This will be realised through funding part of the personnel costs of Senior Experts who are employed at a Dutch research organisation and participate (preferably within a management team) within a CGIAR Research Program (CRP) or Platform with linkages to one or more of the four priority knowledge domains of the thematic strategic partnership.

The Senior Expert Programme (SEP) is one of the four instruments in the Netherlands (NL) - CGIAR research programme. The research programme is related to the partnership agreement between the Government of the Netherlands and the CGIAR System Organization to cooperate on contributing to transformational change in agriculture around the world by advancing food system knowledge and joint public and private innovation. The partnership agreement consists of core funding for certain knowledge domains within the CGIAR System Organization, as well as a number of instruments that focus on strengthening Netherlands-CGIAR research cooperation. Four of the five instruments, including the current call for SEP candidates, are managed by NWO-WOTRO via the NWO NL-CGIAR research programme.

organisation.narrative: The financing instrument is managed by NWO-WOTRO via the NWO NL-CGIAR research programme. For information on NWO-WOTRO see http://www.nwo.nl/wotro

title.narrative: Number of businesses involved in project activities
Modified policies, legal instruments or investments by the research or activities
Number of policies, legal instruments, investments and similar modified in their design or implementation, informed by the research or activities
Number of relevant knowledge institutions supported/engaged directly
Number of trainings, workshops and other capacity development activities developed and held
Number of other output (eg. discussion papers, working papers, broader media outlets, congress contributions).
